article:
A 'writing circle' is a group of like-minded writers needing support
for their work, either through writing peer critiques, workshops or classes, or
just encouragement. There are many different types of writing circles or writing
groups based on location, style of writing, or format. Normally, the goal of a
writing circle is to improve one's own craft by listening to the works and
suggestions of others in the group. It also builds a sense of community, and
allows new writers to become accustomed to sharing their work. Writing circles
can be helpful inside and outside of the classroom.
headings: How Writing Circles Help the Writer
